places.name: Jonsrud Viewpoint
places.description: One of the best views of Mt. Hood in the state of Oregon, which includes the Sandy River Valley. Free and open 24 hours. Telescopic views available.

places.name: North American Bigfoot Center
places.description: A unique and entertaining stop for everyone. Discover rare artifacts related to Bigfoot, and American legend comparable to the Loch Ness Monster. Gift shop and movie theater onsite.

places.name: Vista House at Crown Point
places.address: 40700 Historic Columbia River Hwy, Corbett, Oregon 97019
places.description: An historical site that offers amazing views of the Columbia Gorge and is a memorial to Oregon pioneers. Free with a small shop inside.

places.name: Multnomah Falls
places.address: Exit 31 off of I-84, about 30 minutes East of Portland
places.description: The most famous waterfall in Oregon offers stunning scenery. The waterfall can be seen from the top after a somewhat challenging hike. $2.00 day use fee and a lodge with food and souveniers.

places.name: Boring Station Trailhead Park
places.description: A day use park for picnics and just enjoying nature. The Springwater Corridor bike trail is accessible from the park. Parking and restroom facilities available.

places.name: Liepold Farms
places.description: A family-friendly farm with a petting zoo, tractor rides, corn maze, and depending on the season, fresh berries or pumpkin patch. Tickets available.

places.name: Barton Park
places.address: 19009 SE Barton Park Road, Boring, Oregon 97009
places.description: A park and campground for the entire family. Access to river recreation on the Clackamas River, hiking, biking, picnicking, and lots of family fun. $9.00 parking fee. Campground reservations required if you want to camp.

places.name: Mountain View Golf Course
places.description: A sometimes challenging 18-hole golf course with stunning views, including views of Mt. Hood. Restaurant and Lounge on-site
